Files

gotham_restful_derive/
resource_error.rs

1use crate::util::CollectToResult;
2use proc_macro2::{Ident, TokenStream};
3use quote::{format_ident, quote};
4use std::iter;
5use syn::{
6	parse::Parse, spanned::Spanned, Attribute, Data, DeriveInput, Error, Fields, GenericParam,
7	LitStr, Meta, Path, PathSegment, Result, Type, Variant
8};
9
10struct ErrorVariantField {
11	attrs: Vec<Attribute>,
12	ident: Ident,
13	ty: Type
14}
15
16struct ErrorVariant {
17	ident: Ident,
18	status: Option<Path>,
19	is_named: bool,
20	fields: Vec<ErrorVariantField>,
21	from_ty: Option<(usize, Type)>,
22	display: Option<LitStr>
23}
24
25fn find_attr<T: Parse>(variant: &Variant, ident: &str) -> syn::Result<Option<T>> {
26	variant
27		.attrs
28		.iter()
29		.filter_map(|attr| match &attr.meta {
30			Meta::List(list) if list.path.is_ident(ident) => Some(syn::parse2(list.tokens.clone())),
31			_ => None
32		})
33		.next()
34		.transpose()
35}
36
37fn process_variant(variant: Variant) -> Result<ErrorVariant> {
38	let status = find_attr(&variant, "status")?;
39	let display = find_attr(&variant, "display")?;
40
41	let mut is_named = false;
42	let mut fields = Vec::new();
43	match variant.fields {
44		Fields::Named(named) => {
45			is_named = true;
46			for field in named.named {
47				let span = field.span();
48				fields.push(ErrorVariantField {
49					attrs: field.attrs,
50					ident: field.ident.ok_or_else(|| {
51						Error::new(span, "Missing ident for this enum variant field")
52					})?,
53					ty: field.ty
54				});
55			}
56		},
57		Fields::Unnamed(unnamed) => {
58			for (i, field) in unnamed.unnamed.into_iter().enumerate() {
59				fields.push(ErrorVariantField {
60					attrs: field.attrs,
61					ident: format_ident!("arg{i}"),
62					ty: field.ty
63				})
64			}
65		},
66		Fields::Unit => {}
67	}
68
69	let from_ty = fields
70		.iter()
71		.enumerate()
72		.find(|(_, field)| {
73			field
74				.attrs
75				.iter()
76				.any(|attr| matches!(&attr.meta, Meta::Path(path) if path.is_ident("from")))
77		})
78		.map(|(i, field)| (i, field.ty.clone()));
79
80	Ok(ErrorVariant {
81		ident: variant.ident,
82		status,
83		is_named,
84		fields,
85		from_ty,
86		display
87	})
88}
89
90fn path_segment(name: &str) -> PathSegment {
91	PathSegment {
92		ident: format_ident!("{name}"),
93		arguments: Default::default()
94	}
95}
96
97impl ErrorVariant {
98	fn fields_pat(&self) -> TokenStream {
99		let mut fields = self.fields.iter().map(|field| &field.ident).peekable();
100		if fields.peek().is_none() {
101			quote!()
102		} else if self.is_named {
103			quote!( { #( #fields ),* } )
104		} else {
105			quote!( ( #( #fields ),* ) )
106		}
107	}
108
109	fn to_display_match_arm(
110		&self,
111		formatter_ident: &Ident,
112		enum_ident: &Ident
113	) -> Result<TokenStream> {
114		let ident = &self.ident;
115		let display = self.display.as_ref().ok_or_else(|| {
116			Error::new(self.ident.span(), "Missing display string for this variant")
117		})?;
118
119		// lets find all required format parameters
120		let display_str = display.value();
121		let mut params: Vec<&str> = Vec::new();
122		let len = display_str.len();
123		let mut start = len;
124		let mut iter = display_str.chars().enumerate().peekable();
125		while let Some((i, c)) = iter.next() {
126			// we found a new opening brace
127			if start == len && c == '{' {
128				start = i + 1;
129			}
130			// we found a duplicate opening brace
131			else if start == i && c == '{' {
132				start = len;
133			}
134			// we found a closing brace
135			else if start < i && c == '}' {
136				match iter.peek() {
137					Some((_, '}')) => {
138						return Err(Error::new(
139							display.span(),
140							"Error parsing format string: curly braces not allowed inside parameter name"
141						));
142					},
143					_ => params.push(&display_str[start..i])
144				};
145				start = len;
146			}
147			// we found a closing brace without content
148			else if start == i && c == '}' {
149				return Err(Error::new(
150					display.span(),
151					"Error parsing format string: parameter name must not be empty"
152				));
153			}
154		}
155		if start != len {
156			return Err(Error::new(
157				display.span(),
158				"Error parsing format string: Unmatched opening brace"
159			));
160		}
161		let params = params
162			.into_iter()
163			.map(|name| format_ident!("{}{name}", if self.is_named { "" } else { "arg" }));
164
165		let fields_pat = self.fields_pat();
166		Ok(quote! {
167			#enum_ident::#ident #fields_pat => ::std::write!(#formatter_ident, #display #(, #params = #params)*)
168		})
169	}
170
171	fn status(&self) -> Option<TokenStream> {
172		self.status.as_ref().map(|status| {
173			// the status might be relative to StatusCode, so let's fix that
174			if status.leading_colon.is_none() && status.segments.len() < 2 {
175				let status_ident = status
176					.segments
177					.first()
178					.cloned()
179					.unwrap_or_else(|| path_segment("OK"));
180				quote!(::gotham_restful::gotham::hyper::StatusCode::#status_ident)
181			} else {
182				quote!(::gotham_restful::gotham::hyper::StatusCode::from(#status))
183			}
184		})
185	}
186
187	fn into_match_arm(self, enum_ident: &Ident) -> Result<TokenStream> {
188		let ident = &self.ident;
189		let fields_pat = self.fields_pat();
190		let status = self.status();
191
192		// the response will come directly from the from_ty if present
193		let res = match (self.from_ty, status) {
194			(Some((from_index, _)), None) => {
195				let from_field = &self.fields[from_index].ident;
196				quote!(#from_field.into_response_error())
197			},
198			(Some(_), Some(_)) => {
199				return Err(Error::new(
200					ident.span(),
201					"When #[from] is used, #[status] must not be used!"
202				));
203			},
204			(None, Some(status)) => {
205				quote!(::std::result::Result::Ok(::gotham_restful::Response::new(
206					#status,
207					::gotham_restful::gotham::hyper::Body::empty(),
208					::core::option::Option::None
209				)))
210			},
211			(None, None) => {
212				return Err(Error::new(
213					ident.span(),
214					"Missing #[status(code)] for this variant"
215				));
216			}
217		};
218
219		Ok(quote! {
220			#enum_ident::#ident #fields_pat => #res
221		})
222	}
223
224	fn were(&self) -> Option<TokenStream> {
225		self.from_ty
226			.as_ref()
227			.map(|(_, ty)| quote!(#ty : ::gotham_restful::IntoResponseError))
228	}
229}
230
231pub fn expand_resource_error(input: DeriveInput) -> Result<TokenStream> {
232	let ident = input.ident;
233	let generics = input.generics;
234
235	let inum = match input.data {
236		Data::Enum(inum) => Ok(inum),
237		Data::Struct(strukt) => Err(strukt.struct_token.span()),
238		Data::Union(uni) => Err(uni.union_token.span())
239	}
240	.map_err(|span| Error::new(span, "#[derive(ResourceError)] only works for enums"))?;
241	let variants = inum
242		.variants
243		.into_iter()
244		.map(process_variant)
245		.collect_to_result()?;
246
247	let display_impl = if variants.iter().any(|v| v.display.is_none()) {
248		None // TODO issue warning if display is present on some but not all
249	} else {
250		let were = generics.params.iter().filter_map(|param| match param {
251			GenericParam::Type(ty) => {
252				let ident = &ty.ident;
253				Some(quote!(#ident : ::std::fmt::Display))
254			},
255			_ => None
256		});
257		let formatter_ident = format_ident!("resource_error_display_formatter");
258		let match_arms = variants
259			.iter()
260			.map(|v| v.to_display_match_arm(&formatter_ident, &ident))
261			.collect_to_result()?;
262		Some(quote! {
263			impl #generics ::std::fmt::Display for #ident #generics
264			where #( #were ),*
265			{
266				fn fmt(&self, #formatter_ident: &mut ::std::fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> ::std::fmt::Result {
267					match self {
268						#( #match_arms ),*
269					}
270				}
271			}
272		})
273	};
274
275	let mut from_impls: Vec<TokenStream> = Vec::new();
276
277	for var in &variants {
278		let var_ident = &var.ident;
279		let (from_index, from_ty) = match var.from_ty.as_ref() {
280			Some(f) => f,
281			None => continue
282		};
283		let from_ident = &var.fields[*from_index].ident;
284
285		let fields_pat = var.fields_pat();
286		let fields_where = var
287			.fields
288			.iter()
289			.enumerate()
290			.filter(|(i, _)| i != from_index)
291			.map(|(_, field)| {
292				let ty = &field.ty;
293				quote!( #ty : Default )
294			})
295			.chain(iter::once(
296				quote!(#from_ty : ::gotham_restful::IntoResponseError)
297			));
298		let fields_let = var
299			.fields
300			.iter()
301			.enumerate()
302			.filter(|(i, _)| i != from_index)
303			.map(|(_, field)| {
304				let id = &field.ident;
305				let ty = &field.ty;
306				quote!( let #id : #ty = Default::default(); )
307			});
308
309		from_impls.push(quote! {
310			impl #generics ::std::convert::From<#from_ty> for #ident #generics
311			where #( #fields_where ),*
312			{
313				fn from(#from_ident: #from_ty) -> Self {
314					#( #fields_let )*
315					Self::#var_ident #fields_pat
316				}
317			}
318		});
319	}
320
321	let status_codes = if cfg!(feature = "openapi") {
322		let codes = variants.iter().map(|v| match v.status() {
323			Some(code) => quote!(status_codes.push(#code);),
324			None => {
325				// we would've errored before if from_ty was not set
326				let from_ty = &v.from_ty.as_ref().unwrap().1;
327				quote!(status_codes.extend(<#from_ty as ::gotham_restful::IntoResponseError>::status_codes());)
328			}
329		});
330		Some(quote! {
331			fn status_codes() -> ::std::vec::Vec<::gotham_restful::gotham::hyper::StatusCode> {
332				let mut status_codes = <::std::vec::Vec<::gotham_restful::gotham::hyper::StatusCode>>::new();
333				#(#codes)*
334				status_codes
335			}
336		})
337	} else {
338		None
339	};
340
341	let schema = if cfg!(feature = "openapi") {
342		let codes = variants.iter().map(|v| match v.status() {
343			Some(code) => quote! {
344				#code => <::gotham_restful::NoContent as ::gotham_restful::ResponseSchema>::schema(
345					::gotham_restful::gotham::hyper::StatusCode::NO_CONTENT
346				)
347			},
348			None => {
349				// we would've errored before if from_ty was not set
350				let from_ty = &v.from_ty.as_ref().unwrap().1;
351				quote! {
352					code if <#from_ty as ::gotham_restful::IntoResponseError>::status_codes().contains(&code) => {
353						<#from_ty as ::gotham_restful::IntoResponseError>::schema(code)
354					}
355				}
356			}
357		});
358		Some(quote! {
359			fn schema(code: ::gotham_restful::gotham::hyper::StatusCode) -> ::gotham_restful::private::OpenapiSchema {
360				match code {
361					#(#codes,)*
362					code => panic!("Invalid status code {}", code)
363				}
364			}
365		})
366	} else {
367		None
368	};
369
370	let were = variants
371		.iter()
372		.filter_map(|variant| variant.were())
373		.collect::<Vec<_>>();
374	let variants = variants
375		.into_iter()
376		.map(|variant| variant.into_match_arm(&ident))
377		.collect_to_result()?;
378
379	Ok(quote! {
380		#display_impl
381
382		impl #generics ::gotham_restful::IntoResponseError for #ident #generics
383		where #( #were ),*
384		{
385			type Err = ::gotham_restful::private::serde_json::Error;
386
387			fn into_response_error(self) -> ::std::result::Result<::gotham_restful::Response, Self::Err>
388			{
389				match self {
390					#( #variants ),*
391				}
392			}
393
394			#status_codes
395			#schema
396		}
397
398		#( #from_impls )*
399	})
400}
